page.title: 01Moulin Moor Nr Pitlochry
page.content: This area of heather moorland lies on the northwest and southeast sides of the A924 road from Pitlochry to Kirkmichael & it is used for sheep grazing and grouse shooting. At Knock Barrie (or the Fairies Knoll) there is a plantation of conifers, mainly spruce and larch. The only houses are a cottage near there (gate house) and an empty shepherd's house. Near the latter there is a stone by the road to the memory of a man who perished in a snowstorm while returning from Moulin Market in March 1897. There are a number of old hut circles in the area. At present lorry loads of peat are being taken from a bog to stabilise embankments of the new A9 road at Killiecrankie. From the A924 there is a superb view for miles to the west.
